news.title: Investors aren't the market's biggest loser if Trump, SEC end quarterly reporting
news.summary: The SEC may end the requirement for companies to report results quarterly. The 'Big Four' accounting firms, KPMG, Deloitte, PwC and EY, have a lot to lose.

news.title: This Meta alum has spent 10 months leading OpenAI's nationwide hunt for its Stargate data centers
news.summary: OpenAI is building a massive industrial base to power the future of artificial intelligence. The company is led by Keith Heyde, founder and CEO of tech firm OpenAI.

news.title: AI Sam Altman and the Sora copyright gamble: 'I hope Nintendo doesn't sue us'
news.summary: CNBC has seen videos of characters from shows like "SpongeBob SquarePants" on the platform. CNBC was able to independently generate other characters.

news.title: Warren Buffett Watch: His last big deal as Berkshire CEO before Abel takes over?
news.summary: Berkshire Hathaway has a deal to pay $9.7 billion in cash to buy OxyChem. OxyChem is Occidental Petroleum's chemical business.

news.title: Biggest Trump tax cut benefits for small business owners to keep more income on Main Street
news.summary: President Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill provides small businesses with significant opportunities for bottom-line savings on income tax bills. Small businesses can save up to $10,000 a year on their tax bills under the bill.

news.title: I’m holding my $400K life savings in cash because I’m worried about a stock-market crash. Do I dare invest?
news.summary: “I’m 44. I have been retired for three years now,” says the 44-year-old. “I have to take a break now.”

news.title: ‘I don’t come from money’: I received $1.2 million after a family tragedy. Am I foolish to keep it in a money-market account?
news.summary: “Having a large sum just sitting there freaks me out,” he says. “Having that large sum in my bank account is a bit of a shock.”

news.title: ‘My monthly expenses are $6,500’: I’m 64, have $1.2 million in a 401(k) and two mortgages. Can I afford to retire?
news.summary: “I want to retire next year,” he says. “I’ve been doing this for a long time.”

news.title: ‘I don’t wish to be petty’: My mom, 94, is leaving her $1 million estate to me, my brother and his daughter. Is that fair?
news.summary: “My share of the home alone would be valued at $300K per the trust. If she distributes the funds three ways, my share becomes $200K,” he said.

news.title: ‘He thinks nothing of spending $40K on a new car’: My husband gives me the silent treatment. How can we agree on finances?
news.summary: “I’m looking for a financial planner, marriage counselor and, possibly, a divorce attorney,” the woman says.
